main event: Four or more oblong, flat, circular silvery metallic objects were observed hovering between clouds in Columbia, Tennessee on 20 May 1956.
interesting points: The objects hovered in the same area for three to four minutes and moved up and down and sideways,The observers saw light reflecting off the metallic surfaces of the objects,The sighting occurred at an altitude estimated to be between 20,000 and 30,000 feet,Three teenage observers and one adult confirmed the sighting as not conventional aircraft,The report suggested the sighting could possibly be caused by a cluster of balloons.
sighted object: four or more oblong, flat, circular silvery metallic objects
witness description: three teenagers and one adult, all GOC volunteers
